verses.roman:
atra te varṇayiṣyāmi
gāthāṁ nārāyaṇānvitām
nāradasya ca saṁvādam
ṛṣer nārāyaṇasya ca

synonyms: atra—in this connection; te—to you; varṇayiṣyāmi—I will relate; gāthām—an account; nārāyaṇa-anvitām—concerning the Supreme Lord, Nārāyaṇa; nāradasya—of Nārada; ca—and; saṁvādam—the conversation; ṛṣeḥ nārāyaṇasya—of Śrī Nārāyaṇa Ṛṣi; ca—and.
translation: In this connection I will relate to you a narration concerning the Supreme Lord Nārāyaṇa. It is about a conversation that once occurred between Śrī Nārāyaṇa Ṛṣi and Nārada Muni.

purport.content: Lord Nārāyaṇa is connected in two ways with the following narration: as its speaker and as the subject it describes.
